Material used.Material Name: SH-SY5Y cells and primary neurons from wild-type and Lrrk2 knockout mice
Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells and primary neurons derived from wild-type and Lrrk2 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased phosphorylation of α-synuclein was observed in cells expressing p.G350R LRRK2.
Cells expressing p.M360T LRRK2 showed increased levels of phosphorylated α-synuclein compared to control cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each experimental condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate during Western blotting.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells were used as a positive control to validate the phosphorylation assay.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells and Lrrk2 knockout neurons served as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Not applicable, as phosphorylation levels were compared between experimental conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Not applicable, as phosphorylation levels were compared between experimental conditions.

Approved assay.Description: Western blotting is a commonly accepted method for studying protein expression and phosphorylation in the context of Parkinson's disease.
